channel.title: research on Analyst
channel.description: Recent content in research on Analyst

item.title: ðŸ’« System Supernova
item.description: One of the main things to know when performing forensic analysis is knowing what’s normal and what’s not. It would take ages to google every single pinch of this information, that’s why I have decided to make a clean install of several systems and capture their state to have an idea what’s good for each of them.

item.title: Memory Addressing
item.description: I’ve had a lot of time to dive into certain pecularities of how programs are outlined both in RAM and on disk when working as a malware analyst.

item.title: A Few Good Bits
item.description: Saturday I’ve recently have had a severe poisoning (I only hope it’s not the rotavirus ðŸ˜¨) and I’ve spent one evening and one day barely moving.

item.title: App Transport Security
item.description: In this article I’m trying to untangle a very confusing notion for some people (myself included) - App Transport Security.

item.title: TCP
item.description: This article collects the basics of TCP protocol. Its friend UDP (transport layer protocol as well) is faster but less reliable.

item.title: Reverse Engineering Android Applications ðŸ¤–
item.description: In this article I’m assembling information about debugging applications on Android, then all possible to anti-debugging techniques and how they can be curcumvented (a little spoiler here - almoust always one way ðŸ˜€) .
